name: Air Fryer Potato-Apple Latkes
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'shredded potatoes'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'ranny Smith apple'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'egg yolk'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'flour'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'black pepper'}, {'quantity': '1/4', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'kosher salt'}
steps: Stir together potatoes, apple, egg yolk, flour, pepper, and salt in a large bowl.. Lightly coat air fryer basket with cooking spray. Drop 4 (1/4-cup) scoops potato mixture into basket. Press gently with a spatula to flatten; lightly coat tops with cooking spray.. Set the air fryer to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Cook latkes, turning halfway through, until browned on both sides, 8 to 10 minutes. Repeat with remaining potato mixture. Garnish with sliced green onion and serve with sour cream or crème fraîche.

name: Old-Fashioned Potato Cakes
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'mashed potatoes'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onion, diced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'egg'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'vegetable oil, or as needed'}
steps: Gather all ingredients.. Mix mashed potatoes, flour, onion, egg, black pepper, and salt in a bowl until well combined, similar to a batter consistency.. Heat vegetable oil in a skillet over medium heat. Drop 4-inch circles of batter into the hot oil. Cook until golden brown, about 4 to 5 minutes per side.. Drain on paper towels. Repeat with any remaining batter. Serve and enjoy!

name: Potato Pancakes
ingredients: {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'potatoes'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'yellow onion'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'egg, beaten'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'freshly ground black pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'all-purpose flour, or more as needed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'vegetable oil for frying, or as needed'}

name: My Crispy Mashed Potato Pancake
ingredients: {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'cold mashed potatoes'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'potato starch or cornstarch'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'egg, lightly beaten'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'kosher salt'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'garlic powder'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'thinly sliced fresh chives, divided'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'olive oil, plus 1 teaspoon olive oil, divided'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'cooking spray'}

name: German Potato Pancakes
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'eggs'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'baking powder'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'pepper'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'potatoes, peeled and shredded'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'finely chopped onion'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}
steps: Gather all ingredients.. Beat eggs, flour, baking powder, salt, and pepper together in a large bowl; stir in potatoes and onion.. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Drop heaping tablespoonfuls of potato mixture into hot oil in batches. Press to flatten.. Cook until browned and crisp, about 3 minutes on each side.. Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate to drain.. Repeat with remaining potato mixture. Enjoy!

name: Irish Boxty
ingredients: {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'grated raw potatoes'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'leftover mashed potatoes'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'egg'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'skim milk'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'olive oil'}

name: Potato Latkes

name: Instant Potato Pancakes
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'cold water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'egg, beaten'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dry potato flakes'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'chopped fresh chives, divided'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'freshly ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'cayenne pepper, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'sour cream for garnish'}
steps: Whisk together cold water, egg, and salt in a large bowl until salt has dissolved. Mix in dry potato flakes until incorporated. Stir in 1 tablespoon chives; season with black pepper and cayenne pepper.. Divide potato mixture into 4 equal portions and shape into pancakes.. Heat oil and butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Swirl the pan to combine.. Place pancakes in the pan, reduce heat to medium, and cook until the bottoms are browned, about 10 minutes. Flip and flatten slightly. Cook until other sides are browned, 7 to 8 more minutes.. Transfer pancakes to a serving plate. Top each with a dollop of sour cream and sprinkle with remaining chives.

name: Easy Leftover Potato Pancakes
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'mashed potatoes'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'shredded Cheddar cheese'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'egg, beaten'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup to 3/4 cup', 'name': 'all-purpose flour as needed (Optional)'}
steps: Gather all ingredients.. Mix potatoes, cheese, beaten egg, and salt in a medium bowl until well combined. If the mixture is very wet, mix in flour as needed to bind mixture together.. Melt butter on a large griddle over medium heat.. Drop potato mixture onto the hot griddle, 1/4 cup at a time.. Flatten each pancake with the back of a spatula to 1/2-inch thickness.. Fry until golden brown, about 5 minutes per side. Serve hot.

name: Air Fryer Latkes
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(16 ounce) package', 'name': 'frozen shredded hash brown potatoes, thawed'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'shredded onion'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'egg'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'kosher salt and ground black pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'matzo meal'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'avocado oil cooking spray'}
steps: Preheat an air fryer to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) according to manufacturer's instructions. Lay out a sheet of parchment or waxed paper.. Place thawed potatoes and shredded onion on several layers of paper towels. Cover with more paper towels and press to squeeze out most of the liquid.. Whisk together egg, salt, and pepper in a large bowl. Stir in potatoes and onion with a fork. Sprinkle matzo meal on top and stir until ingredients are evenly distributed. Use your hands to form mixture into ten 3- to 4-inch wide patties. Place patties on the parchment or waxed paper.. Spray the air fryer basket with cooking spray. Carefully place half of the patties in the basket and spray generously with cooking spray.. Air-fry until crispy and dark golden brown on the outside, 10 to 12 minutes. (Check for doneness at 8 minutes if you prefer a softer latke.) Remove latkes to a plate. Repeat with remaining patties, spraying them with cooking spray before cooking.

name: Leftover Mashed Potato Pancakes
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'mashed potatoes'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'egg'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dry bread crumbs, or as needed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'butter'}
steps: Combine mashed potatoes, egg, and pepper in a bowl and mix well together.. Pour bread crumbs into a small bowl. Shape potato mixture into 3-inch patties with wet hands and dip in bread crumbs so they are evenly coated.. Heat oil and butter in a nonstick skillet over medium heat and cook potato cakes on both sides until they are heated through and browned, about 4 minutes per side.

name: Panko Crusted Mashed Potato Cakes
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'chilled mashed potatoes'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'eggs, slightly beaten, (separate bowls)'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'chopped onion'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'black pepper'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'flour for dredging'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'Kikkoman Panko Bread Crumbs'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'vegetable oil for pan frying'}
steps: In a medium bowl, combine potatoes, one egg, onion and black pepper. Divide potato mixture into 8 equal portions. Use your hands to form 1/2 inch thick patties. Dredge patties in flour, then in egg and coat with Panko Bread Crumbs. Meanwhile heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add potato patties to the hot oil. Cook until well browned, turn with a spatula and brown on the other side.

name: Cheesy Potato Pancakes
ingredients: {'quantity': '4', 'unit': None, 'name': 'russet potatoes, peeled and grated'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'eggs'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'milk'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'grated Parmesan cheese'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'shredded Cheddar cheese'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'real bacon bits (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'onion salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'baking powder'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'corn oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons unsalted', 'name': 'butter'}
steps: Combine potatoes, eggs, and milk together in a large bowl.. Stir flour, Parmesan cheese, Cheddar cheese, bacon bits, onion salt, baking powder, salt, and black pepper into potato mixture using a fork.. Heat corn oil and butter in a large skillet over medium heat.. Drop potato mixture by 2 tablespoonfuls onto skillet. Cook patties until golden brown, about 4 minutes per side. Drain cooked pancakes on a paper towel-lined plate.

name: Easy Potato Pancakes
ingredients: {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'potatoes, peeled and shredded'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'eggs, beaten'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}
steps: Combine potatoes, onion, eggs, flour, salt, and pepper in a large bowl; stir until well combined.. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Working in batches, drop large spoonfuls of potato batter into the hot skillet. Flatten batter lightly with a spatula and cook until golden brown, about 4 minutes per side. Serve immediately.

name: Mom's Potato Latkes
ingredients: {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'shredded potato'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'grated onion'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': '', 'name': 'saltine crackers, or as needed, crushed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'eggs, beaten'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt, or more to taste'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'vegetable oil, or as needed'}

name: Baked Potato Latkes
ingredients: {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'peeled and mashed baked potatoes'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped white onion'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'minced garlic'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'freshly ground multi-colored peppercorns'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'eggs, whisked'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'extra-virgin olive oil, or as need for frying'}
steps: Place potatoes, onion, garlic, salt, ground peppercorns, flour, and eggs into a bowl. Fold the mixture together with a rubber spatula, breaking up any large potato chunks, until ingredients are evenly mixed.. Heat oil in a deep-fryer or large skillet to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).. Form latke dough into 3-inch diameter balls and flatten into 1-inch thick rounds.. Working in batches, place latkes in hot oil and cook until edges are golden brown, 3 to 5 minutes. Flip latkes using a slotted spoon and cook until crisp, 2 to 3 minutes more. Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate to cool.

name: Foolproof Potato Latkes
ingredients: {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '', 'name': 'potatoes, peeled and cubed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'eggs'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'all-purpose flour, or as needed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'baking powder'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'canola oil, or as needed'}
steps: Place 1/4 of the potatoes, onion, eggs, salt, flour, and baking powder in the bowl of a food processor; pulse several times until the vegetables are finely chopped. Add remaining potatoes and pulse again until all potatoes are finely chopped and mixture is thoroughly combined.. Heat canola oil in a skillet over medium heat. Scoop up about 1/3 cup of potato mixture at a time and place in skillet. Fry latkes until brown and crisp on the bottom, 2 to 3 minutes. Flip and cook other sides until brown, 2 to 3 minutes longer.. Repeat with remaining potato mixture, replenishing oil as needed. Serve hot.

name: Bramboracky (Czech Savory Potato Pancakes)
ingredients: {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'potatoes'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, crushed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'caraway seeds (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'dried marjoram (Optional)'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'eggs'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'milk'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'oil for frying'}
steps: Peel and coarsely grate potatoes; squeeze out as much liquid as you can. Transfer shredded potatoes to a mixing bowl; stir in garlic, caraway seeds, marjoram, salt, and black pepper.. Beat eggs and milk together; stir into potato mixture until well combined. Gradually stir in flour until a thick but still pourable batter if formed.. Heat about 1/4-inch oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Drop 1/4 cupful batter into skillet, flattening it slightly; fry until golden brown, about 3 minutes on each side. Drain on paper towels. Taste pancake; adjust seasoning if necessary. Repeat with remaining batter.

name: Corned Beef Potato Pancakes
ingredients: {'quantity': '½', 'unit': '(12 ounce) can', 'name': 'corned beef, broken into very small chunks'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'potatoes, shredded'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'green onions, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'egg'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}
steps: Place corned beef into a large bowl with potatoes, green onions, and egg; season with salt and pepper. Form mixture into golf ball-sized balls.. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Place potato balls, a few at a time, into the hot skillet. Flatten balls with a spatula and fry until crisp and golden brown, about 7 minutes per side. Remove to a paper towel-lined plate. Repeat to cook remaining pancakes.

name: Potato Latkes from Simply Potatoes
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(20 ounce) package', 'name': 'Simply Potatoes shredded hash browns, thawed'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': "Better'n Eggs egg substitute"}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'whole wheat flour'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'finely chopped green onion'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'baking powder'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'oil, or more as needed'}
steps: In a large bowl, stir together hash browns, egg substitute, flour, green onion, pepper, salt, and baking powder.. Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a 12-inch nonstick skillet over medium heat.. Cook four latkes at a time. For each latke, spread 1/4 cup potato mixture into a 3 1/2-inch circle in the hot skillet. Cook for 4 to 5 minutes, turning once. Repeat with remaining potato mixture, adding more oil to the skillet as needed. Season with salt and pepper if desired.

name: Chef John's Classic Potato Pancakes
ingredients: {'quantity': '2 ¼', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'russet potatoes, peeled and grated'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': '', 'name': 'yellow onion, grated'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'large eggs'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'freshly ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'cayenne pepper'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'vegetable oil for frying'}
steps: Place potatoes and onion into a large bowl and pour enough cold water in the bowl to cover by several inches. Let rest until potatoes and onion are completely soaked, 20 to 30 minutes. Pour potato mixture into a colander, rinse, drain, and squeeze repeatedly to remove all moisture.. Whisk eggs, flour, salt, black pepper, and cayenne pepper together in a bowl until smooth.. Mix potato mixture and egg mixture together in a large bowl with a spatula.. Heat 1/4-inch oil in a heavy skillet over medium-high heat. When oil shimmers, drop large spoonfuls of potato batter into hot oil and flatten with a spatula to about 1/2-inch thick. Cook until the edges of pancakes are golden brown and crispy, 3 to 5 minutes. Reduce heat to medium, flip pancakes, and cook until golden brown and crispy on the other side, about 5 minutes more. Repeat cooking process with remaining batter.

name: Crispy Potato Pancakes
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'potatoes, peeled and coarsely shredded'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onions, minced'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': '', 'name': 'eggs, beaten'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'baking powder'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'ground nutmeg, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}
steps: Mix potatoes, onions, eggs, flour, baking powder, and lemon juice in a large bowl; season with nutmeg, salt, and black pepper. Shape potato mixture into 12 evenly sized patties.. Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Pan-fry potato patties in batches until tender and browned on both sides, 7 to 10 minutes. Transfer browned patties to a paper towel-lined baking sheet. Repeat with remaining patties.

name: Loaded Mashed Potato Cakes
ingredients: {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'slices', 'name': 'bacon'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'unsalted butter'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'stalk', 'name': 'celery, chopped'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'minced garlic'}, {'quantity': '1 ¼', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'mashed potatoes'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'shredded American cheese'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'egg, slightly beaten'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'prepared yellow mustard'}, {'quantity': '⅛', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'hot sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'sour cream'}
steps: Place bacon in a large skillet and cook over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned, about 10 minutes. Drain bacon on paper towels, reserving bacon grease in skillet; crumble bacon.. Melt butter in bacon grease over medium heat. Add onion, celery, and garlic. Cook until tender and lightly browned, about 15 minutes. Transfer vegetables and bacon to a large bowl. Wipe the skillet clean and set aside; you'll use it again. Add mashed potatoes, cheese, flour, egg, mustard, black pepper, and hot sauce to the bowl. Mix to combine.. Heat vegetable oil in the reserved skillet over medium heat. Drop spoonfuls of mashed potato mixture, flattening slightly, and fry patties until golden brown on both sides, 5 to 7 minutes. Serve with sour cream.

name: Roesti
ingredients: {'quantity': '2 ¼', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'potatoes, scrubbed'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'milk'}
steps: Place the potatoes in a large pot. Cover the potatoes with water. Bring the water to a boil over medium-high heat. Cook the potatoes until tender enough to pierce with a fork, about 15 minutes; drain and refrigerate potatoes overnight.. Peel and grate the potatoes into a large bowl.. Melt the butter in a skillet over medium heat; add the grated potatoes; season with salt. Press the potatoes into a round loaf using a spatula. Sprinkle the milk over them. Cover the skillet with a lid. When you hear the potatoes begin to sizzle in about 5 to 10 minutes, reduce the heat to low. Cook until a brown crust has formed on the bottom, about 30 minutes. Cover the skillet with a large plate and flip the roesti onto the plate to serve.

name: Bacon Potato Pancakes
ingredients: {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'strips', 'name': 'bacon'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Idaho potatoes, peeled and shredded'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'eggs'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '', 'name': 'garlic cloves, minced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'chopped fresh thyme'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'vegetable oil for frying, or as needed'}
steps: Cook bacon in a skillet over medium heat until crisp, 3 to 5 minutes. Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate to drain; let cool and crumble. Reserve bacon drippings in skillet.. Combine crumbled bacon, potatoes, flour, eggs, garlic, thyme, salt, and black pepper in a large bowl.. Pour 1/4-inch vegetable oil into skillet with drippings; heat over medium heat until oil and drippings shimmer.. Gently drop potato mixture by heaping tablespoonfuls into hot oil; flatten into small patties about 3 inches in diameter. Cook until browned, about 3 minutes on each side.

name: Dad's Potato Pancakes
ingredients: {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'potatoes, peeled'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onion'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': '', 'name': 'eggs, beaten'}, {'quantity': '2 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'dry pancake mix'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}
steps: In a food processor grate potatoes and onion. In a large bowl combine potatoes, onions, eggs, pancake mix, salt and pepper.. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Spoon potatoes into skillet and cook as you would pancakes, for 3 to 4 minutes on each side.

name: Delicious Stuffed Potato Pancakes
ingredients: {'quantity': '8', 'unit': '', 'name': 'potatoes, peeled and shredded'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'baking powder'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': '', 'name': 'eggs'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and black pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'ground beef'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onion, grated'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'garlic salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'egg'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'bread crumbs'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}
steps: Mix together potatoes, flour, baking powder, 3 eggs, salt, and pepper in a bowl. In another bowl, mix ground beef, onion, garlic salt, 1 egg, and bread crumbs until well-combined.. Heat oil in a skillet over medium-low heat; drop a rounded tablespoon of potato mixture into the hot skillet. Spread and flatten pancake out a little, and place about 2 teaspoons of beef mixture on top, spreading filling out almost to the edges of pancake. Drop another rounded tablespoon of potato mixture on top, and spread it out to completely cover beef. Fry until the bottom of pancake is golden brown, about 5 minutes; flip and fry other side until golden, 1 to 2 more minutes. Transfer pancake to a paper towel-lined plate. Repeat with remaining potato mixture and beef filling.

name: Vegetable and Feta Latkes
ingredients: {'quantity': '2 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'grated zucchini'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'peeled and shredded potatoes'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'shredded carrots'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': '', 'name': 'eggs, lightly beaten'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt to taste'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'freshly ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'matzo meal'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh parsley'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'crumbled feta cheese'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}
steps: Place the zucchini, potato and carrots in a colander, place paper towels or a cheesecloth over the top and squeeze out as much moisture as possible. Sprinkle salt over the vegetables and let them drain for 15 minutes. Squeeze vegetable again in paper towels.. In a large mixing bowl combine eggs, vegetables, salt and pepper. Mix well. Stir in matzo meal or flour, parsley and feta.. Heat vegetable oil in a large frying pan. Place vegetable mixture, formed into pancake sized cakes in hot oil and fry until golden brown on both sides. (Cook two to three minutes per side). Add more oil as needed to keep cakes frying up well. Drain fried latkes on paper towels.

name: Anne's Potato Pancakes
ingredients: {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'red potatoes, with peel, shredded'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'sweet onion, minced'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': '', 'name': 'eggs, lightly beaten'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'baking powder'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'dried rosemary'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'lime juice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}
steps: In a large bowl, mix the red potatoes, onion, eggs, flour, baking powder, rosemary, salt, pepper, and lime juice.. Heat the oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Scoop about 2/3 cup at a time of the potato mixture into the skillet, and press down with a spatula into a pancake shape. Cook 3 to 4 minutes on each side, until crisp and golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Repeat with remaining potato mixture.

name: Sausage-Stuffed Potato Pancakes
ingredients: {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'Italian sausage links, casings removed'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'russet potatoes, peeled'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'kosher salt'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'freshly ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'cayenne pepper'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'egg, beaten'}, {'quantity': '2 ½', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'diced roasted red peppers'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'sour cream, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'chopped fresh chives, or to taste'}

name: Kay Dee's Recipe for Potato Latkes
ingredients: {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'potatoes, peeled and shredded'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'onion, shredded'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': '', 'name': 'eggs'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'all-purpose flour, or as needed'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}
steps: Place the potatoes and onion into a bowl, and stir in eggs, salt, and flour as needed to make the mixture hold together. With wet hands, scoop up about 1/3 cup of the mixture per patty, and form into flat round or oval shapes.. Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat until it shimmers, and gently place the patties into the hot oil. Fry until the bottoms are golden brown and crisp, 5 to 8 minutes, then flip with a spatula and fry the other side until golden.. Line a colander or strainer with 2 paper towels, and drain the cooked latkes in the colander. Serve hot.

name: Reibekuchen (German Potato Pancakes)
ingredients: {'quantity': '20', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'potatoes'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'egg'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'rolled oats, or more as needed'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'oil, or more as needed'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste'}
steps: Peel potatoes and finely grate. Set grated potatoes onto a clean kitchen towel, twist to close, and press most of the liquid out of the potatoes, leaving only a little moisture.. Mix pressed potatoes, onion, egg, and oats in a large bowl and season with salt and pepper.. Heat oil in a large skillet. Shape small potato pancakes with 2 spoons out of the potato mixture and set into the hot oil. Bake in batches until browned, 3 to 5 minutes per side, adding more oil as necessary. Drain on paper towels before serving.

name: Boxty
ingredients: {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'potatoes, unpeeled'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'buttermilk'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'potatoes, peeled and grated'}, {'quantity': '1 ¾', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'baking soda'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'butter, or as needed'}
steps: Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Scrub the unpeeled potatoes and prick them several times with a fork; place onto a baking sheet.. Bake in the preheated oven until the potatoes are easily pierced with a fork, 50 minutes to 1 hour. Remove, cool, and peel. Mash the potatoes with the buttermilk. Stir in the grated raw potato, flour, baking soda, salt, and pepper.. Melt the butter in a large skillet or griddle over medium heat. Scoop the potato mixture into the skillet to make 3 inch cakes. Fry until golden and crisp, turning once, about 5 minutes per side.

name: Cajun Potato Latkes
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'peeled, shredded potatoes'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onion, shredded'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped green onion'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'eggs, beaten'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'all-purpose flour, or as needed'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'Cajun seasoning, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'canola oil, or as needed'}
steps: Place the potatoes in a cloth, and wring them to remove as much moisture as possible. Mix the potatoes, onion, green onion, eggs, flour, and Cajun seasoning together in a bowl until thoroughly combined.. Heat the oil in a large, heavy skillet over medium heat until it shimmers (oil should be about 1/3 inch deep). Drop about 2 tablespoons of the potato mixture per patty into the hot oil, and flatten the potatoes to make the patties 1/4 to 1/2-inch thick. Brown the patties in the hot oil until golden and crisp on the bottom, about 5 minutes, then flip and cook on the other side. Drain the latkes on paper towels, and serve hot.

name: Potato Leek Latkes
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'russet potatoes, cut into small pieces'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'leek, cut into small pieces'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': '', 'name': 'eggs'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'flaxseed meal'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'grated Parmesan cheese'}
steps: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.. Combine potatoes and leek in a food processor; process until mashed. Add eggs, flaxseed meal, and salt; pulse until incorporated.. Spoon potato mixture onto the lined baking sheet. Flatten gently into 3-inch circles. Sprinkle Parmesan cheese on top.. Bake in the preheated oven until Parmesan cheese is melted and golden brown, about 20 minutes.

name: Chorizo Latkes
ingredients: {'quantity': '3', 'unit': '', 'name': 'russet potatoes, peeled'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'eggs, lightly beaten'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(1 pound)', 'name': 'package beef chorizo'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'yellow onion, diced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}
steps: Shred potatoes; wring out excess water in a dish towel. Transfer to a large bowl and mix in eggs. Season with salt and pepper.. Heat 1 teaspoon oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add chorizo; cook and stir until browned, 4 to 5 minutes. Drain, reserving 1 teaspoon grease in the skillet. Add onion; cook and stir until translucent, about 4 minutes. Fold into potatoes until well-combined.. Heat 1 tablespoon oil in another large skillet until almost smoking. Add heaping tablespoonfuls of the potato mixture; press down to flatten slightly. Cook until golden brown, about 2 minutes per side. Continue with remaining potato mixture. Drain on paper towels.

name: Scallion Mashed Potato Pancakes
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'leftover mashed potatoes'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'eggs'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'sesame oil, divided'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and ground white pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'scallions, chopped'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'vegetable oil, or as needed'}
steps: Mix mashed potatoes, flour, eggs, 1 teaspoon sesame oil, salt, and white pepper together in a medium mixing bowl. The mixture should be a little doughy, enough to form a ball in your palm.. Heat 1 tablespoon vegetable oil in a large frying pan over medium heat. Saute scallions in the hot oil until soft, about 5 minutes. Fold into the potato mixture until combined.. Heat enough vegetable oil in the frying pan to cover by 1/4 inch and add a drizzle of remaining sesame oil.. Form balls of potato mixture using a 1/4 cup measure and flatten into pancakes. Gently place into the hot oil in batches and cook until browned on both sides and somewhat firm, about 5 minutes. Transfer pancakes to a paper towel-lined plate to soak up excess oil. Repeat with remaining mixture, adding more vegetable oil and sesame oil before frying each batch. Transfer to a platter and serve hot.

name: Easy Air Fryer Latkes
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'russet potatoes, peeled and grated'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'eggs'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'onion, sliced'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'seasoned bread crumbs'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'nonstick cooking spray'}
steps: Preheat an air fryer to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).. Place potatoes on a clean kitchen towel and squeeze out any excess moisture. Transfer to a bowl and stir in eggs, onion, bread crumbs, salt, and pepper.. Spray the air fryer basket with nonstick spray. Drop 1/4 cupfuls potato mixture into the basket. Spray tops with nonstick spray.. Air fry until crispy and golden brown, 8 to 12 minutes.

name: Bacon Potato Cakes with Ham Steak, Egg, and Sliced Avocado
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(20 ounce) package', 'name': 'refrigerated hash brown potatoes'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'slices', 'name': 'Pure Farmland® All Natural Uncured Bacon, cooked, roughly chopped'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'freshly grated Parmesan cheese'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'eggs, beaten'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': '', 'name': 'green onions, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cayenne pepper'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'slices', 'name': 'Farmland® Ham Steak, cut in half'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '', 'name': 'eggs, sunny side up, or cooked to your choice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'avocado, thinly sliced'}
steps: Bacon Potato Cakes: In large bowl, combine potatoes, bacon, Parmesan cheese, flour, garlic, eggs, green onions, and cayenne pepper; season with salt and pepper.. Heat olive oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Scoop tablespoons of batter for each pancake, flattening with spatula, and cook until underside is nicely golden brown, about 2 to 3 minutes. Flip and cook on other side, about 2 minutes longer.. To Serve: Place bacon potato cakes on plate and top with ham steak. Top with fried eggs, followed by sliced avocado fanned on top.

name: Backyard Skillet Smashed Potatoes and Onions
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'new potatoes'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onion, minced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'seasoned salt, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'paprika, or to taste'}
steps: Place new potatoes and water in a microwave-safe bowl. Cover and heat on high in a microwave until soft enough to smash, about 8 minutes.. Preheat an outdoor skillet for high heat and lightly oil the grate. Place a cast-iron skillet on the grill to preheat.. Drain water from the potato bowl and add onion and olive oil; mix well. Carefully spread potato mixture into the skillet and smash each potato using the back of a spatula.. Grill until onions are browned and potatoes are crispy, about 5 minutes per side. Season with seasoned salt and paprika.

name: Family Latkes
ingredients: {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'potatoes, peeled'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'grated onion'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'eggs, beaten'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'oil for frying, or as needed'}
steps: Place potatoes in salted water and let sit for about 15 minutes.. Grate potatoes on a medium or fine setting. Press out liquid; this should produce about 4 cups grated potato.. Place grated potato in a bowl and stir in flour, onion, salt, and pepper. Fold in eggs.. Preheat the oven to 250 degrees F (120 degrees C). Line baking sheets with parchment paper.. Heat enough oil in a deep pan to reach 1/4 inch up the sides. Heat over medium-high heat until a drop of batter sizzles. Lower heat to medium.. Working in batches, drop batter into the hot oil in desired size and flatten into pancakes; brown on both sides, 5 to 7 minutes per side. Transfer to the prepared pans and keep warm in the preheated oven while you fry remaining batter.

name: Kicked-Up Potato Pancakes
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'potatoes, peeled and shredded'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'shredded deli smoked ham'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': '', 'name': 'eggs'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'shredded mozzarella cheese'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'onion powder'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'garlic powder'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'olive oil for frying'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'green onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'grated Parmesan cheese'}
steps: Combine potatoes, ham, eggs, mozzarella cheese, onion powder, garlic powder, salt, and black pepper in a bowl.. Heat a large skillet over medium-low heat. Pour enough olive oil to cover bottom of pan.. Scoop up about 1/2 cup of potato mixture per pancake and form into a patty. Repeat, making 8 patties in all.. Place 4 pancakes at time in hot olive oil. Cook until browned, about 4 minutes on each side. Transfer to paper towel-lined plate.. Sprinkle with green onion and Parmesan cheese.

name: Apple-Potato Latkes
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'russet potato, peeled'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'firm apple, peeled'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'egg, lightly beaten'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'maple syrup'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'sea salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'ground nutmeg'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'vegetable oil, or as needed'}
steps: Make a deep vertical cut on each side of the potato and apple.. Attach potato to a spiralizer fitted with the small shredded blade and cut into thin shreds. Repeat with apple. Spread shredded potato and apple on several layers of paper towels; squeeze to release as much moisture as possible. Transfer to a bowl.. Mix egg, flour, maple syrup, salt, and nutmeg into the bowl.. Heat vegetable oil in a skillet over medium heat. Spoon 2 tablespoons of the potato mixture into the skillet; flatten slightly with a spatula. Cook until golden brown, 3 to 4 minutes per side. Drain on a plate lined with paper towels. Repeat with remaining mixture, adding more oil if needed.

name: Potato Latkes with Caramelized Pears, Goat Cheese, and Sherry Vinegar Drizzle
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'peeled and shredded potatoes'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': '', 'name': 'eggs, beaten'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'grated onion'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'oil for frying'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'pears, cored and cut into 1/2-inch slices'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'brown sugar, divided'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'goat cheese, sliced into 1/4-inch thick rounds'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'sherry vinegar'}
steps: Place shredded potatoes in cheesecloth and wring out any excess moisture.. Mix potatoes, eggs, flour, onion, and salt together in a bowl.. Heat 1/2 cup oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat until oil shimmers. Working in batches, drop spoonfuls of the potato mixture into the hot oil, pressing each down to form a pancake. Cook latkes until browned and crisp, 3 to 5 minutes per side; transfer to paper towels to drain.. Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a separate skillet over medium-high heat. Cook pears in hot oil and sprinkle 2 tablespoons brown sugar over pears. Cook pears until browned and sugar is melted, 3 to 5 minutes per side.. Place latkes on a serving platter. Top each latke with 1 round of goat cheese and a pear. Sprinkle brown sugar on the pears and drizzle sherry vinegar over the top.

name: Rainbow Potato Pancakes with Harissa and Eggs
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'vegetable oil for frying, or more as needed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'russet potatoes, peeled and shredded'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'shredded yellow onion'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'purple potatoes, peeled and shredded'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': '', 'name': 'eggs, divided'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'potato starch'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'potato starch'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'kosher salt'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'balsamic vinegar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'white vinegar'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'microgreens'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'sour cream'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'harissa'}
steps: Preheat oil in a 10-inch skillet to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Preheat oven to 200 degrees F (95 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.. Put shredded russet potatoes and 3 tablespoons onion on a clean kitchen towel; squeeze out as much moisture as possible, then transfer to a bowl. Put shredded purple potatoes and remaining 3 tablespoons onion in the same towel; squeeze out as much moisture as possible, then transfer to a separate bowl.. Whisk 4 eggs, 1/2 cup plus 2 tablespoons potato starch, salt, and pepper in a large bowl until smooth. Transfer 1/2 of the egg mixture to another large bowl; stir in balsamic vinegar and fold in purple potato mixture. Fold russet potato mixture into remaining egg mixture.. Drop four 3-tablespoon portions of batter at a time into the hot oil and flatten with a spatula. Fry, turning once, until golden brown, about 8 minutes. Transfer pancakes to prepared baking sheet; keep warm in oven. Repeat with remaining potato mixture.. Fill a large saucepan with 2 to 3 inches of water and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium-low, pour in white vinegar, and keep the water at a gentle simmer. Crack an egg into a small bowl then gently slip egg into the simmering water, holding the bowl just above the surface of water. Repeat with the remaining eggs. Cook eggs until the whites are firm and the yolks have thickened but are not hard, 2 1/2 to 3 minutes.. Remove the eggs from the water with a slotted spoon and dab on a kitchen towel to remove excess water. Top pancakes with poached eggs and microgreens. Serve with sour cream and harissa.
